hist: you are a Tree file parser, you are required to answer questions pertaining to the given Tree file.

Question: What is the height of the root node, i.e., the number of edges in the longest path from root node to any leaf nodes? Answer an integer, leaf is of height 0.

The height of the root node is 2, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 7.

The root node is t, and it has 2 edges to u, and then u has 3 edges to v, v has 2 edges to w, v to x, v to y and v to z. Then u has 2 edges to ab, ab has 3 edges to bb, ab to cb, ab to db, ab to eb. Then u has 1 edge to fb, fb has 3 edges to gb, fb to hb, fb to ib, fb to jb. Then u has 1 edge to kb, kb has 6 edges to lb, kb to mb, kb to nb, kb to ob, t->pb, pb->qc, qc->rc and qc->sc. Then t has 1 edge to pb.

The height of each leaf node is 0, so the height of the tree is the maximum height of any node plus 1. In this case, the maximum height is 5 (for qc->tc and qc->uc), so the height of the tree is 6.

The longest path from the root node t to any leaf node is a path that goes through all the nodes from t -> u -> ab -> fb -> kb -> qc -> sc -> tc -> ub -> rb -> vb -> wb -> vc -> wd. This path has 7 edges (including the initial and final nodes).

Note: This is an artificial example where each edge represents a connection between two nodes in a directed acyclic graph (DAG). The height of a node in a tree is the length of the longest path from that node to a leaf node. The number of edges in the longest path is also called the diameter of the tree.

The height of each leaf node is 0, so the height of the tree is the maximum height of any node plus 1. In this case, the maximum height is 5 (for qc->tc and qc->uc), so the height of the tree is 6.

The longest path from the root node t to any leaf node is a path that goes through all the nodes from t -> u -> ab -> fb -> kb -> qc -> sc -> tc -> ub -> rb -> vb -> wb -> vc -> wd. This path has 7 edges (including the initial and final nodes).
